means: 驱散，消失( dissipate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Her father had dissipated her inheritance.
sentence.Network_cn: 她父亲已经挥霍掉了她继承的遗产。

entry.tran: 放荡无度的;花天酒地的
entry.def: If you describe someone as dissipated, you disapprove of them because they spend a lot of time drinking alcohol and enjoying other physical pleasures, and are probably unhealthy because of this.

example.ex: Flynn was still handsome, though dissipated.
example.tran: 尽管放荡无度，弗林英俊样貌并未有什么变化。

means.word_mean: 2. preoccupied with the pursuit of pleasure and especially games of chance;

sentences.en: The heat had to be dissipated by elaborate cooling systems.
sentences.cn: 热得用复杂的冷却装置散发。

means.word_mean: 沉迷于酒色的;闲游浪荡的

sentences.cn: 不要过沉迷于酒色的生活。

sentences.en: There’s no point in dissipated life.
sentences.cn: 人只沉溺于放荡的生活之中是没有意义的。
